metadata.name: Python Function Execution Security Warning Disabled In Excel
metadata.comment: Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed. Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\microsoft\\office\\')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\excel\\security')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('pythonfunctionwarnings')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' 0')))

output.summary: Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed. Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.
